title: Murder at Hatfield House - Amanda Carmack
description:
1558. Kate Haywood, a simple musician in the employ of a princess, will find herself involved in games of crowns as she sets out to solve the murder of the queenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s envoy....

England is in tumult under the rule of Queen Mary and her Spanish husband. Confined to house arrest at Hatfield House, young Princess Elizabeth is the countryÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s greatest hope. Far from court intrigues, Elizabeth finds solace in simple things: the quiet countryside and peaceful recreation, including the melodies of her chief musician and his daughter, Kate Haywood.

But Kate will prove herself most valuable when an envoy of the queenÃ¢â‚¬â€sent to flush out heretics in the princessÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s householdÃ¢â‚¬â€is found dead on the grounds of Hatfield. Acting as ElizabethÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s eyes and ears, Kate is sent out on the trail of a killer whose mission could destroy her family, friendsÃ¢â‚¬â€and the future of England.

About the Author

Amanda Carmack is a pseudonym for a multipublished author. Her books have been nominated for many awards, including the RITA Award, the Romantic Times ReviewersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Choice Award, the Booksellers Best, the National Readers Choice Award, and the Holt Medallion. She lives in Oklahoma.
